article.headline: Arkansas St. 85, Lyon 42
article.story: JONESBORO, Ark. -- Daniel Bryant scored 16 points to lead Arkansas State to an easy 85-42 victory over Lyon College on Monday night. Donald Boone scored 12 points for Arkansas State and Edward Townsel added 11 points and six steals. Brandon Peterson pulled down 10 rebounds as the hosts enjoyed a 55-28 advantage on the boards. Eleven players scored for the Red Wolves (2-6), who were playing their home opener. They lost in overtime at No. 13 Memphis on Wednesday. Andy Lee and Quinn Cooper led the Scots with 12 points each. Cooper also had eight rebounds, four steals and four assists. Lyon College, an NAIA school, played this game as an exhibition.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
